definitions: state of being watchful and alert especially to avoid danger or threats
examples: The security guard maintained constant vigilance throughout the night shift
Border patrol requires vigilance to detect illegal crossings

definitions: person who takes law enforcement into their own hands without legal authority
examples: The vigilante tracked down criminals the police couldn't catch
Local vigilantes formed a patrol group to protect their neighborhood

definitions: practice of ordinary citizens enforcing law and order without legal authority
examples: The rise in vigilantism worried local law enforcement officials
Community frustration with crime sometimes leads to dangerous vigilantism

definitions: short descriptive literary sketch or brief evocative scene
small decorative design or illustration on a page
examples: The author included several vignettes about her childhood memories
Each chapter began with a charming vignette from daily life
The book featured beautiful vignettes bordering each page
Delicate floral vignettes decorated the wedding invitation

definitions: physical strength energy and enthusiasm in doing something
examples: The young athlete competed with remarkable vigor and determination
She attacked the project with renewed vigor after vacation

definitions: physical strength energy and enthusiasm in doing something
examples: The team played with tremendous vigour throughout the match
His vigour for life inspired everyone around him

definitions: large luxurious house usually in the countryside or by the sea
examples: They rented a Mediterranean villa for their summer vacation
The hillside villa offered spectacular views of the coastline

definitions: person who lives in a village or small rural community
examples: The villagers gathered in the square for the annual festival
Local villagers knew everyone in their small community

definitions: character in a story who opposes the hero and does evil things
examples: The movie villain had an elaborate plan for world domination
Every fairy tale needs a villain to create dramatic conflict

definitions: wicked or criminal behavior typical of a villain
examples: The detective uncovered a web of villainy and corruption
His acts of villainy shocked even hardened criminals

definitions: lively energetic spirit and enthusiasm for doing things
examples: She tackled every challenge with vim and determination
The new employees brought fresh vim to the workplace

definitions: action of clearing someone of blame or proving something is justified
examples: The new evidence provided complete vindication of his actions
She sought vindication after years of false accusations

definitions: person who clears someone of blame or defends their reputation
examples: The lawyer acted as her vindicator in the public trial
History became the ultimate vindicator of his controversial theories

definitions: plant with long thin stems that grows by climbing on surfaces
examples: Grape vines covered the entire wall of the cottage
The jungle was thick with tangled vines and undergrowth

definitions: sour liquid made from fermented wine or cider used in cooking
examples: She added vinegar to the salad dressing for extra tang
White vinegar works well for cleaning windows and mirrors

definitions: plantation of grapevines typically for making wine
examples: The family vineyard produced award winning wines every year
Tourists enjoyed walking through the scenic hillside vineyard

definitions: informal word for wine especially cheap or ordinary wine
examples: They shared a bottle of vino at the local tavern
The restaurant served decent vino at reasonable prices

definitions: year or place in which wine was produced
period when something was produced showing its age and quality
examples: The 1982 vintage was exceptional for French wines
This bottle comes from an excellent vintage
She collected vintage clothing from the nineteen fifties
The car show featured vintage automobiles in pristine condition

definitions: strong flexible plastic material used for various products
plastic material used to make gramophone records
examples: The kitchen floor was covered with durable vinyl tiles
Vinyl siding protected the house from weather damage
Collectors searched for rare vinyl records at the shop
Many music fans prefer vinyl to digital formats

definitions: stringed musical instrument slightly larger than a violin with deeper tone
examples: She played viola in the school symphony orchestra
The viola section provided rich harmonies in the composition

definitions: person who breaks or fails to comply with rules or laws
examples: Traffic violators received hefty fines from the police department
Repeat violators faced suspension of their driving privileges

definitions: small plant with purple blue or white flowers
bluish purple color like that of violet flowers
examples: Wild violets bloomed along the forest path every spring
She picked fresh violets for her mother's birthday bouquet
The artist mixed blue and red to create violet
Her dress was a beautiful shade of deep violet

definitions: wooden stringed instrument played with a bow held against the shoulder
examples: She practiced violin for three hours every single day
The violin solo moved the audience to tears

definitions: person who plays the violin especially as a profession
examples: The famous violinist performed at Carnegie Hall last night
Young violinists competed for the prestigious music scholarship

definitions: person who plays the viola especially as a profession
examples: The orchestra hired a new principal violist this season
Professional violists often started as violin players

definitions: large stringed instrument of violin family played upright between the knees
examples: The violoncello provided deep bass notes in the quartet
She studied violoncello at the prestigious music conservatory

definitions: venomous snake with long hinged fangs that fold back when not in use
examples: The desert viper struck quickly at the passing mouse
Hikers watched carefully for vipers on the rocky trail

definitions: person who has never had sexual intercourse
person or thing in pure untouched or unspoiled state
examples: The young virgin waited for her wedding night
Many cultures have traditions regarding virgins and marriage
They explored virgin territory never mapped before
The virgin forest remained untouched by human development

definitions: state of never having had sexual intercourse or being sexually pure
examples: Some cultures place great importance on virginity before marriage
She chose to maintain her virginity until finding true love

definitions: quality of having strength energy and strong sexual drive traditionally associated with men
examples: The warrior culture prized virility and physical prowess above all
His virility remained strong even in his advanced years

definitions: scientist who studies viruses and viral diseases
examples: The virologist discovered a new strain of influenza virus
Leading virologists worked together to understand the pandemic

definitions: branch of science that deals with the study of viruses
examples: She earned her doctorate degree in molecular virology
Recent advances in virology helped develop new vaccines

definitions: great skill in music or another artistic pursuit
examples: The pianist displayed incredible virtuosity during the difficult concerto
Her virtuosity on the guitar amazed even professional musicians

definitions: person highly skilled in music or another artistic pursuit
examples: The young virtuoso performed complex pieces with apparent ease
Piano virtuosos from around the world competed in the contest

definitions: degree of damage or harm caused by a disease or poison
examples: Scientists studied the virulence of different bacterial strains carefully
The virulence of the outbreak concerned health officials worldwide

definitions: official authorization allowing entry into or exit from a country
examples: She applied for a tourist visa three months before traveling
His work visa allowed him to stay for two years

definitions: person's face or facial expression especially in literary contexts
examples: His stern visage frightened the young children away
The portrait captured her serene visage perfectly

definitions: measure of a fluid's resistance to flow or its thickness
examples: Motor oil viscosity changes with temperature variations
The scientist measured viscosity using specialized laboratory equipment

definitions: British nobleman ranking below an earl and above a baron
examples: The viscount inherited his title from his late father
Lord Pemberton held the title of viscount for decades

definitions: tool with two jaws for holding work firmly in place
examples: The carpenter tightened the vise to secure the wood piece
He used a bench vise for precision metalworking projects

definitions: state of being able to see or be seen clearly
examples: Poor visibility forced the airport to delay several flights
The fog reduced visibility to less than fifty meters

definitions: person with original ideas about what the future could be like
examples: The tech visionary predicted smartphones decades before their invention
Environmental visionaries pushed for sustainable energy solutions early

definitions: formal or official visit especially for inspection or supervision
appearance of a supernatural being
examples: The bishop's annual visitation included all regional churches
Prison visitation hours were strictly limited to weekends
Many claimed to witness the visitation of angels
The ghost's visitation terrified the old mansion's residents

definitions: act of going to see someone or somewhere for social or business purposes
examples: Visiting hours at the hospital end at eight o'clock
Regular visiting helps elderly relatives feel less isolated

definitions: movable shield attached to cap or helmet to protect eyes from sun
examples: The baseball cap's visor shaded her eyes from bright sunlight
The knight lowered his visor before entering battle

definitions: pleasing view especially one seen through a long narrow opening
examples: The mountain trail opened to a breathtaking vista below
Each window framed a different vista of the countryside

definitions: formation of mental visual images or the act of making something visible
examples: Athletes use visualisation techniques to improve their performance
Data visualisation helps people understand complex statistics better

definitions: formation of mental visual images or the act of making something visible
examples: The coach taught visualization exercises to build player confidence
Computer visualization transformed raw data into understandable graphics

definitions: state of being strong active and full of energy
examples: Regular exercise helps maintain vitality throughout your life
The city's cultural vitality attracted artists and musicians
